content:
The provided chunk of code is part of a method in a Python class that manages particle effects. Specifically, it handles writing configuration data for different types of emitters, such as setting bounds for a 'RectangleEmitter' or parameters like radius and spread for a 'RingEmitter'. This section appears within an `elif` chain that checks the type of emitter (`self.emitterType`) and writes corresponding setup instructions into a file. The code is used to serialize emitter configurations, capturing properties specific to each emitter type for later use or documentation.

point = self.emitter.getMinBound()
            file.write((targ + '.emitter.setMinBound(Point2(%.4f, %.4f))\n' % (point[0], point[1])))
            point = self.emitter.getMaxBound()
            file.write((targ + '.emitter.setMaxBound(Point2(%.4f, %.4f))\n' % (point[0], point[1])))
        elif self.emitterType == "RingEmitter":
            file.write('# Ring parameters\n')
            file.write(targ + '.emitter.setRadius(%.4f)\n' % self.emitter.getRadius())
            file.write(targ + '.emitter.setRadiusSpread(%.4f)\n' % self.emitter.getRadiusSpread())
            if eType == "ETCUSTOM":
                file.write(targ + '.emitter.setAngle(%.4f)\n' % self.emitter.getAngle())
        elif self.emitterType == "SphereSurfaceEmitter":
            file.write('# Sphere Surface parameters\n')
            file.write(targ + '.emitter.setRadius(%.4f)\n' % self.emitter.getRadius())
